title: MPALA Lab
meta: Motion Planning, Active Learning, and Autonomy Lab · Spring 2025 - Present
summary: My research has spanned designing and simulating resilient consensus protocols (such as W-MSR), tuning Kalman filters for localization accuracy, and translating theoretical models of multi-agent coordination into experimental demonstrations. I enjoy the challenge of bridging rigorous mathematical analysis with hands-on implementation, refining flight dynamics, and debugging distributed systems to make autonomous swarms robust against uncertainty and adversarial interference.

title: Surf Poster – Multi-Agent Visualization
summary: A visual research artifact communicating multi-agent coordination concepts through generative surf-style graphics.

title: MIRROR Lab
meta: Mines Interactive Robotics Research Lab · Fall 2024 - Spring 2025
summary: Contributed to research on multi-robot teleoperation and AI-driven robotic systems with a focus on communication, coordination, and decision-making. Integrated multiple laboratory robots using ROS to enable collaborative experiments and structured data collection. Enhanced multi-teleoperation interfaces with DIARC, improving usability, responsiveness, and experimental performance. Developed and tested an AI-powered robotic assistant leveraging machine learning to improve real-time adaptability and decision-making. Co-authored a research paper on robotics and multi-agent systems (publication pending), contributing to technical writing and academic dissemination.
